PARAGRAPH.STRING: (西江, pinyin: Xī Jiāng, Postal map spelling: Si Kiang, lit. "West River") is the western tributary of Pearl River in southern China. The other two main tributaries of Pearl River are Dongjiang River and Beijiang River. Many parts of
is the largest of the tributaries, being 2,197 km. Other transliterations include Hsi River and Hsi Chiang.
supplies water to many places in Guangxi, Guangdong and Macao.
Another Xi is a minor tributary of the Jiulong River northwest of Xiamen.
